content: CONTINUATION OF BENEFITS THROUGH MONTH OF BENEFICIARY'S DEATH. The amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to old-age insurance benefits and wife's insurance benefits, such as removing certain clauses and redesignating subparagraphs. These changes aim to streamline the benefit process and ensure continuity of benefits until the beneficiary's death. The amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to husband's and child's insurance benefits, including redesignating subparagraphs and removing certain clauses to ensure benefits continue until the beneficiary's death. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including adjusting the ending month criteria for benefits in case of remarriage or death. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including adjusting the criteria for ending benefits in case of remarriage or death for parents and mothers/fathers. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to widow's and widower's insurance benefits, including adjusting the criteria for ending benefits in case of remarriage or death for parents and mothers/fathers. The amendments include modifications to Disability Insurance Benefits and Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals under specific sections of the Act. SEC. 2. COMPUTATION AND PAYMENT OF LAST MONTHLY PAYMENT. Amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act to include a new subsection regarding the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit payment upon death. The monthly insurance benefit for an individual who dies will be calculated based on the number of days in the month before their death. This calculation is applied after all other adjustments to the benefit have been made. Payment will be made according to section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection in section 223 for Disability Insurance Benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection in section 223 for Disability Insurance Benefits. Last Payment of Benefit Terminated by Death. The Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection in section 223 for Disability Insurance Benefits. The amount of an individual's monthly benefit paid for the month of their death is calculated based on a fraction of days in that month. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Benefits at Age 72 for Certain Uninsured Individuals are amended in the Social Security Act. The last payment of benefits is adjusted upon the death of the individual, calculated based on the days in the month before the death. This adjustment is made after all other benefit adjustments have been applied. SEC. 3. Amends the Social Security Act to disregard the benefit for the month of death under family maximum provisions. SEC. 4. The amendments apply to deaths occurring after the enactment of this Act.
